meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>whittle down</kanji> and the verb vocab version is <vocabulary>to whittle something down</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to shave something down</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>to reduce something</vocabulary>.

This verb is transitive, meaning you're whittling something down, like a piece of wood, or reducing something, like your expenses.
readingMnemonic: <vocabulary>To whittle something down</vocabulary> or not <vocabulary>to whittle something down</vocabulary>. Will have to take it on a <reading>case</reading> (けず) by case basis.
